content: easy to knit brioche headband is the perfect middle season accessory this pattern is easy to follow and suitable for beginners knitting their first ever brioche piece the headband is worked in one piece back and forth on straight or circular needles instruction videos that will help you with the cast on and finish of your headband are available on my youtube channel links are in the pattern yarn suggestions medium weight yarn aran/worsted approximately 100 m - drops - daisy 50g = 110 m and kid silk 25g = 210 m one strand of each yarn is held together - föa - natua 50g = 100 m and föa - nuvia 25g = 225 m one strand of each yarn is held together - föa - tinta 100g = 200 m and föa - nuvia 25g = 225 m one strand of each yarn is held together - knitting for olive - heavy merino 50g = 125m - filcolana - peruvian 50g = 100m or any yarn to obtain the gauge gauge 16 x 20 stitches in briche stitch = 10 cm 4 in using the needles no 4 5 mm us/uk 7 after washing and blocking needles circular or straight needles no 4 5 mm us/uk 7 1 marker and tapestry needle sizes s m l 51 53 55 cm head circumference 55 57 59 cm headband is knitted with 4 cm negative ease width is 10 5 cm
